H0.text: One student lifts a rock and skips it across a stream best demonstrates the characteristics of science.

H1.text: One student thinks about rocks and writes down his opinion is the best demonstration of the characteristics of science.

H2.text: Two students studying a rock and then comparing their observations best demonstrates the characteristics of science.

H3.text: Two students removing rocks from a garden and then planting flowers best demonstrates the characteristics of science.

A4.text: The systematic, careful collection of measurements or counts of relevant quantities is often the critical difference between pseudo-sciences, such as alchemy, and science, such as chemistry or biology.

A5.text: When empirical evidence is limited, scientists favor parsimony and invariant observations.
